abstracts.cdata!:
The First Edo State Growth and
            Employment Support Credit for Nigeria received a moderately
            satisfactory outcome rating with moderate risk to
            development outcome. Both the Bank and the Borrower received
            satisfactory ratings for their part in the project. The
            project was restructured to extend the closing date by one
            year. The extension was necessary to provide the Edo State
            Government with adequate time for the operation given the
            delay in national parliamentary approval of Nigerias
            2011/2012 External Borrowing Plan which in turn led to
            delays in the signing of the credit agreements and
            declaration of credit effectiveness. The project development
            objective (PDO) and key outcome indicators remained
            unchanged. There were several lessons learned from the
            project and include the following: (1) a key lesson is that
            the commitment of the State Government to reforms is
            critical to the success of the state-level subnational
            development policy operations (DPOs), (2) the use of DPOs at
            the state level to promote good governance and economic
            growth is increasingly motivating other state governments in
            Nigeria to sustain their reform-oriented programs, (3) the
            existence of complimentary projects with funding for
            technical assistance supported the implementation of prior
            actions and enhanced sustainability program reforms, (4) the
            use of private sector information communication and
            technology (ICT) experts helped with the speedy
            implementation of public sector modernization components of
            the DPO such as the integrated financial management
            information system (IFMIS) and education management
            information system (EMIS), and (5) mainstreaming the
            monitoring and evaluation (M&E) system during program
            implementation is critical for ensuring effective monitoring
            of progress being made on key development objective indicators.
